Line 14: Line 14:
'''Windows Live OneCare''' (previously known as '''Windows OneCare Live''' and formerly [[code name]]d '''A1''') is a [[computer security]] and performance enhancement service developed by [[Microsoft]] for some of its [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] [[operating system]]s. The software is an annual paid subscription, which can be used on up to three computers.
'''Windows Live OneCare''' (previously known as '''Windows OneCare Live''' and formerly [[code name]]d '''A1''') is a [[computer security]] and performance enhancement service developed by [[Microsoft]] for some of its [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] [[operating system]]s. The software is an annual paid subscription, which can be used on up to three computers.
â
On November 18, 2008, Microsoft announced that Windows Live OneCare would be discontinued June 2009 and will instead be offering users a new free anti-malware suite codenamed ''[[Morro (software)|Morro]]'' to be available before then. However, virus definitions, subscription renewal and support for OneCare will continue until ''Morro'' ships. Users are encouraged to use [[Windows Live]] services for alternative features (such as [[Windows Live Photos]] instead of OneCare's ''Photo Backup'' feature). It is expected that the [[Windows Live OneCare Safety Scanner]] will also be discontinued as part of this announcement.<ref>[http://www.liveside.net/main/archive/2008/11/18/microsoft-discontinues-windows-live-onecare-offers-lightweight-alternative-for-free.aspx LiveSide: Microsoft discontinues Windows Live OneCare â offers lightweight alternative for free] ([[2008-11-18]])</ref>
+
On November 18, 2008, Microsoft announced that Windows Live OneCare would be discontinued June 2009 and will instead be offering users a new free anti-malware suite codenamed ''[[Microsoft Security Essentials|Morro]]'' to be available before then. However, virus definitions, subscription renewal and support for OneCare will continue until ''Morro'' ships. Users are encouraged to use [[Windows Live]] services for alternative features (such as [[Windows Live Photos]] instead of OneCare's ''Photo Backup'' feature). It is expected that the [[Windows Live OneCare Safety Scanner]] will also be discontinued as part of this announcement.<ref>[http://www.liveside.net/main/archive/2008/11/18/microsoft-discontinues-windows-live-onecare-offers-lightweight-alternative-for-free.aspx LiveSide: Microsoft discontinues Windows Live OneCare â offers lightweight alternative for free] ([[2008-11-18]])</ref>
